title: Using the Angular async pipe

title: Angular Error Interceptor
desc: When applications make HTTP requests and fail, we need to handle them. Ideally, we take care of these errors in one place in our code. In this article, we discover how to handle these exceptions in Angular by using an interceptor. We look into the best steps to take directly in the interceptor before sending errors on their way to the error handler.

title: Angular Tutorials: Intercepting all Network/XHR calls in the Angular app | Mocking API response
desc: Watch this video if you all want to  intercept all the network/XHR calls within your app. We could have done this via the HTTP interceptor that Angular provides but that will not intercept the widget calls which internally go through. Hence, we have used javascript to intercept all possible calls and return a mock JSON which would be present in the UI repo itself. This is the second episode of a multi-part series where in I will be going over a plethora of topics related to Angular.
